definition: to empty (a bag)/to turn inside out/to turn out
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: Please line the drawers with clean paper after you have emptied them.
sentences.chinese: 请把抽屉倒空后铺上干净纸。

sentences.english: The police emptied her bag and examined the contents.
sentences.chinese: 警察把她的包倒空，检查了里面的东西。

sentences.english: Vacuums carpets & empties ashtrays and urns.
sentences.chinese: 为地毯吸尘并倒空烟灰缸及金属容器。

sentences.english: Jenny emptied the box just now.
Love is like an hourglass, with heart filling up as the brain empties.
sentences.chinese: 爱情如砂漏，当脑子倒空时心却满满的。

sentences.english: He rifled the first seven or eight cartridge-boxes without much danger.
sentences.chinese: 他倒空了最初七八个弹药包，冒的危险还不算大。

sentences.english: He tilted the barrel so as to empty it.
Love is like an  hourglass, with the heart filling up as the brain empties.
sentences.chinese: 爱情就象一个砂漏，当脑子倒空的时候心就被填满了。

sentences.english: The kenosis: The self-emptying of Christ.
He tilted the car (up) to empty it.
He tilted the car ( up ) to empty it .
If a man empties his purse into his head, no man can take it away from him.
sentences.chinese: 如果倒空钱袋，装入脑袋，那就无人能够把钱夺走。

definition: container for holding and pouring water (or other liquid): jug, pitcher, clay jar, jerry can, water bottle etc
to make up for what is lacking/to fill (a vacancy)/to replenish
jug (earthenware with a big belly and a small opening)
